QuICT.core.circuit package¶

Submodules¶

QuICT.core.circuit.circuit module¶

class QuICT.core.circuit.circuit.Circuit(wires)¶

Bases: object

Implement a quantum circuit

Circuit is the core part of the framework.

id¶

the unique identity code of a circuit, which is generated globally.

Type

int

const_lock¶

a simple lock that ensures the circuit does not change when running some algorithm.

Type

bool

name¶

the name of the circuit

Type

str

qubits¶

the qureg formed by all qubits of the circuit

Type

Qureg

gates¶

all gates attached to the circuit

Type

list<BasicGate>

topology¶

The topology of the circuit. When the topology list is empty, it will be seemed as fully connected.

Type

list<tuple<int, int>>

fidelity¶

the fidelity of the circuit

Type

float

Private Attributes:

__idmap(dictionary): the map from qubit’s id to its index in the circuit __queue_gates(list<BasicGate>): the gates haven’t be flushed

add_topology(topology)¶

public API to add directed edges in topology to the circuit

Parameters

topology (list<tuple<qureg/qubit/int>>) – a list of directed edges

add_topology_complete(qureg: QuICT.core.qubit.qubit.Qureg)¶

add directed edges to make subgraph formed by qureg passed in fully connected

Parameters

qureg (Qureg) – the qureg to be fully connected in topology

append(gate, qureg=None)¶

add a gate to the circuit

Parameters

  • gate (BasicGate) – the gate to be added to the circuit

  • qureg (Qureg/Qubit/None) – the Qureg/Qubit gate added to. if Qureg is None, use the targs and cargs in gate

assign_initial_random()¶

remove all gates and set all qubits into a qState with random amplitude

assign_initial_zeros()¶

remove all gates and set all qubits into a qState with state 0

Parameters

circuit_depth(gateTypes=None)¶

the depth of the circuit for some gate.

Parameters

Returns

the depth of the circuit

clear()¶

clear the circuit

property const_lock¶
draw_photo(filename=None, show_depth=True)¶

draw the photo of circuit in the run directory

Parameters

  • filename (str) – the output filename without file extensions, default to be the name of the circuit

  • show_depth – whether to show a red frame for gates in the same layer (Note that some gates in the same layer cannot be represented in the row in the photo)

exec()¶

calculate the gates applied to the circuit, change the qStates’ values in the circuit

It may cost a lot of time, the computational process is coded by C++ with intel tbb parallel library

exec_release()¶

calculate the gates applied to the circuit and remove the gates in the circuits

when call the function “exec”, the gates in the list “self.gates” won’t be removed because the integrity of the information of circuit should be ensured. But sometimes, user may release the memory by removing them.

extend(gates)¶

add gates to the circuit

Parameters

gates (list<BasicGate>) – the gate to be added to the circuit

property fidelity¶
force_copy(other, force_copy=None)¶

remove all gates and copy another circuits’ qubits state to the qureg in this circuit

Parameters

  • other (Circuit) – the copy goal

  • force_copy – the indexes of qureg to be pasted in the circuit, if want cover whole circuit, leave it to be None

Returns

property gates¶
property id¶
index_for_qubit(qubit, ancilla=None) → int¶

find the index of qubit in this circuit

the index ignored the ancilla qubit

Parameters

  • qubit (Qubit) – the qubit need to be indexed.

  • ancilla (list<Qubit>) – the ancillary qubit

Returns

the index of the qubit.

Return type

int

Raises

Exception – the qubit is not in the circuit

matrix_product_to_circuit(gate) → numpy.ndarray¶

extend a gate’s matrix in the all circuit unitary linear space

gate’s matrix tensor products some identity matrix.

Parameters

gate (BasicGate) – the gate to be extended.

property name¶
partial_prob(indexes)¶

calculate the probabilities of the measure result of partial qureg in circuit

Note that the function “flush” will be called before calculating this function is a cheat function, which do not change the state of the qureg.

Parameters

indexes (list<int>) – the indexes of the partial qureg.

Returns

the probabilities of the measure result, the memory mode is LittleEndian.

Return type

list<float>

print_infomation()¶
qasm()¶

get OpenQASM 2.0 describe for the circuit

Returns

OpenQASM 2.0 describe or “error” when there are some gates cannot be resolved

Return type

str

property qubits¶
random_append(rand_size=10, typeList=None)¶

add some random gate to the circuit :param rand_size: the number of the gate added to the circuit :type rand_size: int :param typeList: the type of gate, default contains CX、ID、Rz、CY、CRz、CH :type typeList: list<GateType>

reset()¶

reset all qubits in the circuit with gates unchanged

property topology¶

QuICT.core.circuit.circuit_computing module¶

QuICT.core.circuit.circuit_computing.inner_matrix_product_to_circuit(circuit, gate) → numpy.ndarray¶
QuICT.core.circuit.circuit_computing.inner_partial_prob(circuit, indexes)¶

calculate the probabilities of the measure result of partial qureg in circuit

Note that the function “flush” will be called before calculating this function is a cheat function, which do not change the state of the qureg.

Parameters

  • circuit (Circuit) – the circuit to be dealt

  • indexes (list<int>) – the indexes of the partial qureg.

Returns

the probabilities of the measure result, the memory mode is LittleEndian.

Return type

list<float>
